frameDefinitions: An event or state (here termed an Eventuality) or time-Period is described in terms of the Degree to which its duration diverges from a standard.
Temporary or permanent Styles and Configurations of Hair, as well as its inherent Nature.
In this frame a Fluid moves from a Source to a Goal along a Path or within an Area.  '
The words in this frame describe the 'fictive' motion of a stationary Road.

A Financial_instrument (a bond or insurance) fulfills a condition at a certain Time after which the Issuer of the Financial_instrument is legally obligated to pay the Holder a monetary Value, based on the instrument's original Principle and the Interest rate.

A Phenomenon is portrayed with respect to the Degree of likelihood that it will  be perceived and known, given the (usually implicit) Evidence, Perceiver, and the Circumstances in which it is considered.
frameExamples: After a <t>lengthy</t> discussion with the Foreign Minister, Mr. Qian Qichen, they met the Prime Minister.
On either side her head gleamed coiled <t>braids</t> of dark-gold hair , almost pale copper in the subdued light of the room .
The long mountain road <t>meandered</t> through the woods.
The bond had <t>matured</t> to its full value at 30 years.
It's abundantly <t>obvious</t> that we'll need to spend more time on public perception.
listRoleDefinitions: A situation, action or event whose duration is being described.  The Eventuality occurs as the External Argument if the adjective is used predicatively, or as the modified noun if the adjective is used attributively: <fex name='Eventuality'>The lecture</fex> was <t>short</t>. We had a <t>lengthy</t> <fex name='Eventuality'>conversation</fex>.

Sometimes these adjectives describe simply a period of time, rather than an event or state.  The Period almost invariably occurs as the modified noun with an attributive adjective: We waited for only a <t>short</t> <fex name='Period'>time</fex>. Use of the drug over a <t>lengthy</t> <fex name='Period'>period</fex> can cause memory loss.
This role is the hair itself
This role is the Possessor of the body part.
Temporary Configurations of hair (eg braid, bun, ponytail).   Something done to the hair merely by movement.
A property of the hair (eg curly, fine, brown).  This acts much like 'Descriptor' in the Observable_bodyparts Frame.  Colors, styles, natural properties are described by this frame element.
<fen>Area</fen> is the setting in which the <fen>Fluid</fen>'s movement takes place on an unspecified <fen>Path</fen>.
<fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Fluid</fen> ends up.
The <fen>Path</fen> is the trajectory along which the <fen>Fluid</fen> moves.
The <fen>Source</fen> is the location the <fen>Fluid</fen> occupies initially.
The <fen>Fluid</fen> is the entity that changes location and moves in a fluidic way.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Fluid</fen> flows.
The Place describes the location of the motion which has a specified Source, Path or Goal.

Any expression which implies a definite starting-point of the <fen>Road</fen>. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. In particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
The trajectory that would be followed by one moving on the <fen>Road</fen>.
Any expression which tells where the fictive mover travelling along a <fen>Road</fen> would end up.

A physical path that a virtual moving entity can be imagined to travel along.
<fex name='Road'>The bike trail</fex> <t>zigzagged</t> through the woods.
This frame element is used for expressions which describe a general area in which motion takes place when the motion is understood to be irregular and not to consist of a single linear path.
The configuration formed by the entire <fen>Path</fen> along the <fen>Road</fen>.
The direction in which a 'fictive' mover would travel along a <fen>Road</fen>.

The time when the fictive motion takes place.  This may describe the time when the <fen>Road</fen> or a particular piece of the <fen>Road</fen> existed, or it may implicitly describe the time when an actual motion event occurred on the <fen>Road</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> is where the motion (which is specified by a <fen>Source</fen>, <fen>Path</fen> or <fen>Goal</fen>) is located.
The bond, insurance, or debt security which a Holder buys from an Issuer.
When the <fen>Financial_instrument</fen> reaches maturity.
The entity or facts that are undeniable given the <fen>Evidence</fen>.
The gradable aspect of a <fen>Phenomenon</fen> which concerns how likely it is that the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> be known. This frame element is incorporated by the lexical units in this frame.
A modifier expressing  the deviation of the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> from the norm or from the value for another <fen>Phenomenon</fen> in terms of how likely the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> would be known.
The <fen>Time</fen> during which the <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is obvious
listRoleExamples: <fex>At Oregon Caves</fex>, a stream runs through the dining room.
The Way descends <fex>from the City of the Peak</fex> through a dense forest.
The pass dips <fex>down</fex> about 2000 feet, and then <fex>back up</fex> again.
<fex>Thousands of years ago</fex>, the Roman roads criss-crossed this landscape.
<fex>In the mountains</fex>, Highway 60 winds and swerves a lot, so we lost a couple of hours from my estimate.
It is obvious for example <fex>that 9/10 is not the same as 1</fex>.
It is <fex>abundantly</fex> obvious you have not a clue how the Retro Program works.
It is obvious <fex>now</fex> that Senator O. T. Tawa has no plan.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: The Maoris of the South IslandPublication
The Journal of the Polynesian Society
the early part of the eighteenth century
nine hundred or a thousand years
